intro: Razoumofskya jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican razoumofskya, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
